name: Anubis' Nectar
description:
The ultimate Strawberry Ice Cream worthy of the Egyptian Gods.

The one and only strawberry worthy of standing up to the heavy ice creams in this recipe is simply INW Shisha Strawberry. Rather than being than pushed out by the creams and fading away after a week, it only becomes stronger and more refined.

The TFA VBIC and HS Ice Cream form a splendid homespun ice cream texture that is extremely creamy and flavorful. Exceptionally rich and decadent without going overboard.

Keeping the FA Pear at 0.5% does an amazing job at adding a little bit of extra tang to the strawberry profile. Not only that, it also gives the overall recipe a nice wet mouth feel. After 3-4 days, the pear flavor is no longer detectable at all, but leaves behind all the other great qualities.

For a little bit of extra zing and freshness, we add the FA Lemon Sicily to really bring the strawberry to life.

Lastly, we add a little bit of FA Meringue to sweeten up the ice cream profile.

This is best after 4-5 days once the pear and lemon have dissipated, but still makes an incredible and interesting shake and vape.
author: Vurve

reviews.text: Solid recipe. The pear and lemon work you described to bring some freshness to the strawberry. The hs ice cream mixed with the tpa vbic make a really nice cream. And the meringue makes it just sweet enough without being overly sweet.

Sweet, buttery strawberry ice cream. I was worried about Shisha Strawberry; that flavor and I tend to disagree. Somehow the HS Ice Cream bullies it down from its syrupy high horse into an authentic ice cream sort of strawberry. The Pear and Lemon Sicily work together to lift the right parts of the strawberry without letting that jammy quality emerge. Obviously HS IC and TPA VBIC are a fantastic combo. They're so thick and buttery and rich.. I felt like they were fighting with the strawberry as a shake and vape, but after a 2 week steep everything has melded together into a cohesive and fully satisfying ice cream. Highly recommended.
